comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: From www.nyhistory.org/node/45765 Elizabeth Callender Stevens was the daughter of Francis B. Stevens. She was married to her second cousin Richard Stevens (1868-1919) on November 11, 1893, in Hoboken, New Jersey. Mrs. Stevens married her second husband, Josef Forman, a Czechoslovakian diplomat, in England on October 12, 1925. The marriage ended in divorce in 1927. librarycollections.stevens.edu/items/show/591 Indicates that she and Richard Stevens had four children.

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: A 1908 Social Register books.google.com/books?id=GBQMAAAAYAAJ&pg=PA535&l... suggests that both Mrs. Richard Stevens, nee Elizabeth Callender Stevens, and her daughter, went by "Elsie". So another picture in this set is probably her debutante daughter.

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: Columbia alumni news, Volume 10 books.google.com/books?id=n44hAQAAMAAJ&pg=PA981&l... indicates that Richard Stevens died of pneumonia on May 18, 1919

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: NYT of Oct 1925 select.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=F60A12FF39551B7A... carries the announcement of her wedding to Josef Forman, "MRS. ELSIE STEVENS TO WED IN ENGLAND; Wealthy Castle Point Widow to Marry Today Josef Forman of Czechoslovakia, a Writer." NYT of Feb 22, 1927 select.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=F3081EF83F5F147A... announces their divorce.

comment.author: 35072786@N08
comment._content: Hello Swanq:  Looks like you have the correct identification for Elizabeth Callender Stevens,  daughter of Francis B. Stevens who married first Richard Stevens (1868-1919) and second in 1925,  Josef Forman.  We will update our description.
